search_results.description:
🇭🇺On the morning of November 4, 1956, #Soviet tanks entered #Budapest. 🇭🇺#Hungarian radio broadcast the last, dramatic appeals from Prime Minister Imre #Nagy and #Hungarian writers, ending with the words: Help! Help! Help! On the afternoon of November 4, Vienna received what was probably the last signal from a radio station in #Hungary still controlled by the freedom-fighting rebels. It, too, was broadcasting repeated appeals for help. Help did not arrive. Soviet troops brutally crushed the #Hungarian uprising. At least 2,700 people died on the defending side, and at least ten times as many were injured. Thousands of participants in the uprising were arrested. Some of them were executed. Imre Nagy, among others, was hanged for "counter-revolutionary activities."
🇭🇺Ranem 4 listopada 1956 roku sowieckie czołgi wkroczyły do Budapesztu. 🇭🇺Węgierskie radio nadało wówczas ostatnie dramatyczne apele premiera Imre Nagya i #węgierskich pisarzy  zakończone słowami: Pomóżcie! Pomóżcie! Pomóżcie! Popołudniu 4 listopada w Wiedniu odebrano prawdopodobnie ostatni sygnał ze stacji radiową na Węgrzech, którą kontrolowali jeszcze walczący o wolność rebelianci. Ona również nadawała powtarzające się apele o pomoc. Pomoc nie nadeszła. Wojska #sowieckie krwawo stłumiły węgierskie powstanie. Po stronie obrońców zginęło co najmniej 2,7 tys. osób, rannych było co najmniej dziesięć razy więcej. Tysiące uczestników powstańczego zrywu zostało aresztowanych. Część z nich stracono. Za "działalność kontrrewolucyjną" powieszono między innymi Imre Nagya.

🇭🇺1956. november 4-én reggel szovjet tankok vonultak be Budapestre. 🇭🇺A magyar rádió közvetítette Nagy Imre miniszterelnök és magyar írók utolsó, drámai felhívásait, melyek a következő szavakkal értek véget: Segítség! Segítség! Segítség! Bécs valószínűleg november 4-én délután kapta az utolsó jelet egy magyarországi rádióállomástól, amelyet még a szabadságért harcoló lázadók irányítottak. Többször is közvetített segélykéréseket.
A segítség nem jött. A szovjet csapatok véresen leverték a magyar forradalmat. A védekező oldalon legalább 2 700 ember halt meg, és legalább tízszer ennyien megsérültek. A felkelés több ezer résztvevőjét letartóztatták. Néhányukat kivégezték. Többek között Nagy Imrét is felakasztották "ellenforradalmi tevékenységéért".

#Węgry #historia #Magyarország #történelem #powstaniewęgierskie #Hungarianuprising

question: Why is the Battle of Stalingrad considered a turning point in World War II?
result:
On June 20, 1944, just before the D-Day landings, the map of WWII highlighted significant Soviet victories in Moscow, Leningrad, Stalingrad, and Kursk, with Operation Bagration set to liberate the Baltics. The Western Allies postponed D-Day for two years, aiming for high Soviet casualties, and only opted for the liberation of France upon realizing Stalin could reach the English Channel by the following summer., Mamayev Kurgan Memorial complex "To the heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" in Volgograd is a symbol of heroism and patriotism, and a tribute to the m, On November 4, 1942, airborne "pioneers" from the 294th and 336th assault battalions arrived in Stalingrad to take part in Operation Hubertus, the final German offensive aimed at breaching Soviet defenses in the northern sector of the city and reaching the Volga during World War II., On November 6-7, 1941, the focus shifts from the Great October celebrations to a significant moment in the Great Patriotic War and the global anti-fascist struggle, emphasizing the failure of the "Blitzkrieg" strategy and highlighting two important speeches by Stalin in Moscow., The user expresses a nuanced view of both leaders, acknowledging that while they have some appreciation for them, the relationship was complex. They highlight Stalin's initial intention to use Germany as a front for the USSR, which shifted to a neutral or even anti-German stance when that plan failed, exemplified by his support for the British coup in Yugoslavia., On this day in 1942, a reflection on the devastation in Stalingrad is shared, highlighting the ruins of the city after intense battles on November 5, 1942. The accompanying black and white photography emphasizes the destruction, capturing the wrecked buildings that symbolize the impact of World War II., La battaglia di Kiev, avvenuta dopo la liberazione di Stalingrado e la vittoria a Kursk, rappresenta un momento cruciale che segna l'inizio della fine del Terzo Reich e il processo di liberazione dell'Europa da parte dell'Armata Rossa., @Vrykolakkas @jonathanbfine Winter 1942, Stalingrad, Summer 1943, firestorm in Hamburg, February 1943, 35.000 dead, 900.000 displaced. Bombing of Dres, German soldiers' letters from the 1943 Battle of Stalingrad expose the grim realities they faced as Russian forces advanced, highlighting the failures of Hitler's invasion.

search_results.description:
The Battle of Westerplatte, considered the opening battle of WWII, marked the first clash between German and Polish forces on September 1, 1939. 

— The Polish had established an ammunition depot on the Westerplatte peninsula, granted by the League of Nations in 1924, with permission to station 90 soldiers. 

— At 4:45 a.m., the German battleship Schleswig-Holstein, on a supposed friendly visit to Gdańsk, opened fire on the Polish depot. 

— Despite intense bombardments, the initial German infantry assault suffered heavy casualties due to poor preparation. 

— The Polish garrison held out until September 7, losing 15 men while inflicting around 300 German casualties.

— The Battle of Westerplatte became a symbol of Polish resistance against overwhelming odds. It not only marked the beginning of World War II but also bolstered Polish morale during a time of national crisis.

This is the map of WWII on the eve of the D-Day landings on June 20, 1944. The Soviet Union had already won the Battles of Moscow, Leningrad, Stalingrad, and Kursk, and was about to unleash Operation Bagration and liberate the Baltics.

The Western Allies delayed D-Day for two years, hoping the Soviets would take as many casualties as possible, and only decided on the liberation of France after realizing Stalin might reach the English Channel by the next summer!

Mamayev Kurgan Memorial complex "To the heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" in Volgograd is a symbol of heroism and patriotism, and a tribute to the memory of those who died in the most significant land battle in the human history which became a turning point in the World War II. https://t.co/K21jpapFVt

Il #4novembre 1942 affluivano via aereo a #Stalingrado i "pionieri" dei battaglioni d'assalto 294. e 336. per partecipare all'operazione #Hubertus: l'ultimo attacco tedesco contro il settore settentrionale della città per forzare le difese sovietiche e raggiungere il Volga #WWII https://t.co/gjOPJDHzcU

November 6-7, 1941: In lieu of posting about Great October, as in previous years, we are highlighting a turning point in the Great Patriotic War of the Soviet peoples and world anti-fascist war, the failure of “Blitzkrieg” and the great Stalin’s two speeches in Moscow. https://t.co/B15gWoV1cD

@MarxWoltmann I somewhat like both leaders but it wasn't all sunshine and rainbows, Stalin wanted to turn Germany into a front for the USSR and then when realized that wasn't happening he moved into a neutral, if not anti-German position with things like backing the British coup on Yugoslavia

#OTD in 1942
‘Ruins of part of the city of Stalingrad, on November 5, 1942, following huge battles, with wrecked shells of buildings on either side.’
#blackandwhitephotography #streetphotography #urbanphotography #warphotography #Stalingrad #WW2 https://t.co/59apV8y5Bj

—25/26—
Preceduta dalla liberazione di Stalingrado (febbraio 1943) e dalla vittoria russa a Kursk (agosto 1943), la battaglia di Kiev segnava l’inizio della fine del Terzo Reich e la liberazione dell’Europa da parte dell’Armata Rossa. https://t.co/jMr86exCaL

@Vrykolakkas @jonathanbfine Winter 1942, Stalingrad, Summer 1943, firestorm in Hamburg, February 1943, 35.000 dead, 900.000 displaced. Bombing of Dresden, 25.000 dead. 8/May 8, 1945 Capitulation. Love for fascism dies in several brutal episodes.

Hell of the 1943 Battle of Stalingrad revealed in German soldiers' letters sent as Russian troops closed in amid failure of Hitler's invasion
via https://t.co/SoLYFq4fjs https://t.co/gXMURlhqmH

question: In what year did 'The Birth of a Nation' surpass 'Gone with the Wind' as the highest-grossing film of all time, adjusting for inflation?
result:
The tweet highlights the enduring legacy of Batman in cinema, detailing the box office earnings and release years of ten Batman films, with total earnings exceeding $6 billion. It emphasizes Batman's impact as a symbol of justice and the unique contributions of various directors, from Tim Burton to Christopher Nolan. The tweet invites fans to share their favorite Batman movie and moments, fostering engagement within the DC community., Hollywood has infused a "woke mind virus" into its productions over the past decade, negatively impacting the entertainment industry and distancing itself from American audiences. This shift is reflected in a significant decline in box office sales, dropping from $12 billion in 2018 to $9 billion in 2023, marking a 25% decrease (36% when adjusted for inflation), indicating that Hollywood is losing its audience., Disney's success with the Frozen franchise, both films grossing over $1 billion, is highlighted, alongside the enduring popularity of Snow White when adjusted for inflation, also based on a German fairy tale. The tweet notes that Inside Out and its sequel were created by a German filmmaker known for other notable works, suggesting a pattern in Disney's successful adaptations of older European tales. The overall tone implies that the connections between these films and their origins are clear and not surprising., The tweet discusses the decline of the "hope and change" slogan, suggesting it has become outdated and replaced by nostalgia as a more effective theme. It highlights how BBM capitalized on this nostalgia, noting that the year's top-grossing films, "Inside Out 2" and "Deadpool and Wolverine," each earned over a billion dollars by leveraging nostalgic elements., A 1982 film directed by Stephen Spielberg and produced by Amblin Productions had a production budget of $10.5 million and grossed $792 million at the box office, highlighting its significant financial success., The author reflects on receiving $4.6 million for their work "It’s In the Air" in 1986, noting that this amount equates to $13.2 million in 2024 dollars, suggesting it was a favorable deal. They encourage readers to explore further details through a linked resource available on Amazon and Kindle, and welcome reviews., A documentary revealed that the song from The Lion King generated over $15 million, contributing to the film's record-breaking success upon its initial release., Upcoming animated films are projected to earn significant box office revenues, with "Frozen III" expected to reach $1 billion, "Incredibles 3" and "Zootopia 2" both anticipated at $1.1 billion, and "Toy Story 5" at $900 million. Other films like "Moana 2" may earn between $700-800 million, "Mufasa" around $800 million, "Elio" at $500 million, and "Hoppers" expected to make $450 million., The tweet emphasizes the importance of financial metrics, highlighting a stark contrast between two entities: one with a market cap of $300 million and another with a market cap of $2.3 billion. The phrase "Follow the money; stats don’t lie" suggests that financial data is a reliable indicator of value or success, prompting reflection on the significant disparity in market capitalization., The tweet highlights the impressive box office gross of $1.465 billion, expressing a sense of astonishment or emotional reaction, as indicated by the crying emoji.

🦇 The Batman Legacy: Box Office Hits and Iconic Moments 🦇

From the shadows of Gotham to the big screen, Batman has captivated audiences worldwide. Here’s a journey through all Batman movies, showcasing their incredible earnings and release years:

1. Batman (1989) - $411 million

2. Batman Returns (1992) - $266 million

3. Batman Forever (1995) - $336 million

4. Batman & Robin (1997) - $238 million

5. Batman Begins (2005) - $373 million

6. The Dark Knight (2008) - $1.005 billion

7. The Dark Knight Rises (2012) - $1.081 billion

8. Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016) - $873 million

9. Justice League (2017) - $657 million

10. The Batman (2022) - $770 million

🌌 With each film, Batman has proven to be more than just a character. His resilience and courage have resonated with fans, making him one of the most enduring symbols of justice. From Tim Burton’s gothic take to Christopher Nolan’s gritty realism, every director has added a new dimension to the Dark Knight.

📊 Total earnings across these films highlight Batman’s unstoppable popularity, amassing over $6 billion at the box office!

Which Batman movie is your favorite? Share your top Batman moment below! 🖤💥
#Batman #DarkKnight #GothamCity #DCFans

A decade ago Hollywood injected the woke mind virus in everything they produce - movies, television and video games, poisoning the entire entertainment industry and alienating the American public. 

In 2018, peak box office sales in the US reached $12 Billion - five years later it declined to $9 Billion, a 25% decline (36% when adjusted for inflation). Hollywood is losing its audience.

Disney makes Frozen, which is based off an older European fairytale. Does $1B+ Makes Frozen 2. Another $1B+ movie. Snow White is still the king when adjusted for inflation. Based off an older German fairy tale. Inside Out & IO2 was made by a German who has also made other great films. 

It's not some mystery.

takeaway is that "hope and change" seems to no longer be a winning slogan. it's nostalgia. 

bbm won by hijacking nostalgia. even our two highest grossing films this year, inside out 2 and deadpool and wolverine, made a quick billion each from nostalgia. https://t.co/oCqQAGLS78

This movie as filmed in 1982 was made by Amblin Productions. And the movie had a production budget of $10.5 million. The box office ticket income was $792 million and Stephen Spieberg was the director of the movie.

I guess the 4.6 million we got for It’s In the Air back in 1986 was a good deal, 13.2 in 2024 dollars! Read this and you can figure out how. Amazon and Kindle, reviews appreciated. https://t.co/RBYctR35xe

question: how long does 503 service unavailable last on average
result:
The duration of a 503 Service Unavailable error can vary, but based on recent experiences, it often lasts around 4 hours, as indicated by a specific case where the downtime began at 2:04 pm with an expected resolution time of 4 hours. However, there are instances where the issue may resolve much quicker, such as within 30 minutes, depending on the root cause and the efficiency of the engineering team addressing it. In some cases, users have reported ongoing issues for days, suggesting that the average downtime can be inconsistent and heavily reliant on the specific circumstances surrounding the outage.
        

**Summary:** The duration of a 503 Service Unavailable error typically varies, with recent reports indicating an average downtime of around 4 hours. This estimate is based on specific incidents where the downtime was officially communicated as lasting 4 hours from the start time. However, there are cases where the issue was resolved much quicker, sometimes within 30 minutes, depending on the underlying cause and the responsiveness of the technical team. Additionally, some users have experienced prolonged outages lasting several days, highlighting that the average downtime can be inconsistent and influenced by various factors. Overall, while a 4-hour resolution is common, the actual duration can fluctuate significantly based on the situation.

question: when was higgs boson discoverd at LHC?
result:
The Higgs boson was discovered at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) on July 4, 2012, by the ATLAS and CMS collaborations at CERN, marking a significant milestone in particle physics.
        

**Summary:** The Higgs boson was discovered at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) on July 4, 2012. This groundbreaking achievement was made by the ATLAS and CMS collaborations at CERN, representing a pivotal moment in the field of particle physics. The discovery confirmed the existence of the Higgs field, which is essential for explaining how particles acquire mass. This event has since spurred extensive research and exploration into the properties and implications of the Higgs boson.

search_results.description:
Precision and Discovery at the Frontiers of Elementary Particle Physics --> Josh Bendavid, MIT --- Abstract: While the discovery of the Higgs boson and the measurement of its mass largely completed the Standard Model, major open questions remain,
including the nature and origin of neutrino masses, the baryon asymmetry in the universe, dark matter and energy, and the microscopic nature of spacetime and gravity.  Supported by robust advancements in accelerator and detector technology, computing, machine learning, and analysis techniques, as well as theoretical advancements, current and future experiments offer an unprecedented opportunity to probe the Standard Model at high precision, and conduct direct and indirect searches for what lies beyond.

The colloquium is held in Feynman Lecture Hall

So it begins… the heavy-ion run at the #LHC 💪

Yesterday at 11.13 am, a new #HeavyIon run began at the Large Hadron Collider, smashing together lead ions at an energy of 5.36 TeV per nucleon pair.

While the LHC mostly collides protons, once a year it collides heavy ions – such as lead nuclei – a key ingredient for preparing the primordial soup called the quark–gluon plasma, a state of matter known to have existed shortly after the #BigBang.

For the next 17 days, every minute counts to take lead–lead collision data.

Find out more: https://t.co/lbdqBZXiqb

Excited to share the first results using Neural Simulation-Based Inference (NSBI) techniques applied to @ATLASexperiment data! We measure the elusive off-shell Higgs boson with 3.1x better observation sensitivity than standard (histogram) analysis techniques! A thread: (1/N) https://t.co/2SBMYSsKAW

Heavy ions smash in the ATLAS Experiment! 🎇🎉

Yesterday, at 11.13 am CET, a new heavy-ion run began at the #LHC, as beams collided lead ions at an energy of 5.36 TeV per nucleon pair. Check out the first ATLAS event displays below and learn more: https://t.co/Wc9Ml5CQZa https://t.co/oemrDT2UHM

Cracking open the Higgs shell!

The ATLAS Collaboration has released an impressive new measurement of “off-shell” Higgs boson production using AI techniques. Check out our new physics briefing to learn more: https://t.co/ioTYBxUSUT

question: why are nasa astronauts delayed returning from space station?
result:
NASA astronauts are delayed in returning from the International Space Station due to a prolonged mission that was initially planned for just eight days but has now extended to over 22 weeks. This delay is primarily linked to issues with the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which has raised concerns about the health of the astronauts aboard. As a result, their return is now scheduled for February 2025, following a suspension of spacewalk activities due to a leaky spacesuit that occurred in June.
        

**Summary:** NASA astronauts are experiencing significant delays in their return from the International Space Station (ISS), with their mission extending from an originally planned eight days to over 22 weeks. This prolonged stay is largely attributed to complications with the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which has raised health concerns for the astronauts. Their return is now projected for February 2025. Additionally, spacewalk activities have been suspended due to a leaky spacesuit incident that occurred in June, further complicating the situation. The combination of these factors has led to increased scrutiny and pressure on NASA regarding the astronauts' well-being and the operational status of the spacecraft.

question: who wrote the lives of twelve caesars?
result:
The "Lives of the Twelve Caesars" was written by the Roman historian Suetonius.
        

**Summary:** The "Lives of the Twelve Caesars" is a significant historical work authored by the Roman historian Suetonius. This text provides detailed biographies of the first twelve emperors of Rome, offering insights into their lives, reigns, and the political climate of the time. Suetonius's work is a crucial resource for understanding Roman history and the personalities that shaped it.

search_results.description:
For those of us in the Peanut Gallery, a little background...
"The reference to "Chrestus" by the Roman historian Suetonius appears in his work The Twelve Caesars, specifically in his account of the life of Emperor Claudius. In this text, Suetonius mentions that Claudius expelled Jews from Rome due to disturbances caused by someone named “Chrestus”:

“Since the Jews constantly made disturbances at the instigation of Chrestus, he expelled them from Rome.” (The Twelve Caesars, Claudius 25.4)

Interpretation of “Chrestus”
The identity of “Chrestus” has been debated by historians for centuries, and the name itself raises a few questions:

Misidentification of Christ?Many scholars believe that "Chrestus" might be a misspelling or a variant spelling of "Christus" (the Latinized form of "Christ," or Christos in Greek), meaning "the anointed one." This could imply that Suetonius was referring to followers of Jesus Christ, whose presence and teachings caused division and conflict among Jewish communities.
Early Christians were sometimes associated with Judaism because Christianity was initially seen as a Jewish sect. The disturbances Suetonius mentions could have been due to disagreements within the Jewish community regarding the teachings of Jesus, leading Claudius to expel the Jews (and likely early Christians) from Rome to avoid further unrest.

Separate Individual Named Chrestus?Alternatively, some scholars argue that "Chrestus" may have been an actual person, perhaps a Jewish agitator or leader who caused disturbances independent of the figure of Christ. “Chrestus” was a relatively common name in the Roman world, meaning “useful” or “good” in Greek, and it is possible Suetonius was referring to an individual other than Jesus.

Common Usage of “Chrestus” for ChristiansIn early Rome, the terms Christus (Christ) and Chrestus (meaning "the good one") were sometimes used interchangeably by non-Christians. This could reflect Suetonius’s unfamiliarity with Christian terminology or theology, and his account might indicate general unrest related to the spread of Christianity rather than disturbances caused by a specific leader or teacher.

Historical and Religious Context

In the 1st century, disputes between Jews and early Christians were common, particularly as Christianity began to spread through the Roman Empire and diverged further from Judaism. The historian Cassius Dio also mentions Claudius’s actions against the Jews, though he does not mention “Chrestus” specifically, further suggesting that the disturbances may have been due to broader tensions rather than an individual figure.
In the New Testament, Acts 18:2 also refers to Claudius’s expulsion of Jews from Rome, mentioning that a Christian couple, Priscilla and Aquila, were forced to leave Rome at this time. This passage supports the idea that early Christian teachings were likely a source of unrest in the Jewish community, possibly leading to Claudius's decision.

Conclusion
While it remains uncertain whether "Chrestus" was an actual person or simply a misidentification of Jesus Christ, Suetonius's reference is generally seen as an early, indirect acknowledgment of the disruptive effect of Christian teachings within Jewish communities. This incident is one of the few non-Christian sources from antiquity that appears to reference early Christian movements, lending historical support to the presence and influence of Christianity in 1st-century Rome.
4o"

question: burj khalifa when did it surpass cn tower?
result:
The Burj Khalifa surpassed the CN Tower in height when it was completed in 2010, becoming the tallest building in the world at that time. The CN Tower, which held the title before the Burj Khalifa, was completed in 1976.
        

**Summary:** The Burj Khalifa officially surpassed the CN Tower in height upon its completion in 2010, establishing itself as the tallest building in the world. Prior to this, the CN Tower, completed in 1976, held the title for several decades. This transition marked a significant milestone in architectural achievements, highlighting the advancements in building technology and design that allowed for the construction of taller structures.

question: What was the objective of Ukraine's counteroffensive in March 2022?
result:
Ukraine's Yermak outlines conditions for peace, demanding the complete withdrawal of Russian troops, cancellation of annexations, and demilitarization of the Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant, while expressing willingness to consider other parties' interests. He claims negotiations will only start after troop withdrawal, which Russia dismisses, stating it will continue its offensive but remains open to negotiations. The tweet highlights the ongoing tensions and unrealistic expectations surrounding the conflict., Ukrainian sources warn that advancing Russian forces near Kurakhovo pose a significant threat to the southern front, with key supply routes being targeted. Russian troops are reportedly closing in on the village of Razdolnoye and blocking access to Uspenovka, while their main goal seems to be capturing Razliv. A military source, identified as "Muchnoy," describes the situation as a potential disaster that could lead to the collapse of Ukrainian defenses in the area., Ukraine will not accept proposals that threaten its existence, the right to self-determination or the dignity of our people, - Head of the Office of t, Russia should fully withdraw from Ukrainian territory, establishing a neutral buffer zone along the border of approximately one mile, similar to typic, The tweet critiques a document perceived as a plan for Ukraine's dismantling, highlighting key elements such as the elimination of its military, the imposition of Russian as the state language, the use of communist symbols, and the requirement for Ukraine to finance the reconstruction of Donbas, which would benefit Russia. It suggests a scenario of total control over Ukraine without any compensation., The tweet emphasizes the importance of Ukraine maintaining its territorial integrity and not agreeing to a ceasefire without the withdrawal of Russian forces. It firmly rejects any compromise on the 1991 borders and the surrender of Kursk possessions, advocating for continued military action against Russian forces as essential for Ukraine's survival., Meduza reports on Russian demands during negotiations with Ukraine in March 2022, highlighting that these demands reveal Putin's ultimate goal of eliminating Ukrainian sovereignty., Russia's success in achieving its initial objectives hinges on fully liberating the Donbass and left-bank Zaporozhye regions, while also establishing a credible threat to the cities of Dnipro and Kharkov., The focus should be on halting Russian advances and ensuring the sustainability of the Ukrainian population, with an emphasis on significantly reducing losses., Russia asserts that its Special Military Operation (SMO) objectives will be fulfilled irrespective of the U.S. presidential administration. search_results.description:
‼️🇺🇦🤡 Ukraine continues to dream about the borders of 1991
▪️ The head of the office of the expired president, Yermak, again voices impossible dreams and “menacingly” sets conditions for achieving peace.
"Complete and unconditional withdrawal of Russian troops from all of Ukraine. Cancellation of illegal annexations. Demilitarization and deoccupation of the Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant. Restoration of freedom of movement," he listed Kyiv's wishes to the Latvian publication LSM.
▪️At the same time, he added that “Kyiv is ready to take into account the interests of other interested parties.”
▪️Yermak recently stated that negotiations with Russia will begin after the withdrawal of its troops from Ukraine along the border in 2022 (i.e. never)
▪️Russia rejects these demands and says it will continue its offensive on the front. At the same time, the Kremlin says it is ready for negotiations on Ukraine.

🇺🇦🇷🇺 "A Total Disaster Could Lead to Collapse of the Southern Front," Says Ukrainian Source

> Russian forces are advancing on key supply routes near Kurakhovo, pushing through Ukrainian defenses on the southern Donetsk front.

> Ukrainian sources report that Russian troops are approaching the village of Razdolnoye, attacking west of Yasnaya Polyana.

> Additionally, Russian forces have progressed northwest of Bogoyavlenka, blocking routes to Uspenovka and moving closer to Konstantinovka.

> According to the Ukrainian source with the call sign "Muchnoy," Russia’s primary objective appears to be seizing control of Razliv and cutting off supply routes west of Kurakhovo.

> "As a military member, I see this as a disaster that could lead to the collapse of the southern front," concluded the Ukrainian source.

#UkraineRussiaWar

Ukraine will not accept proposals that threaten its existence, the right to self-determination or the dignity of our people, - Head of the Office of the President of Ukraine Yermak in an interview with LSM

"Complete and unconditional withdrawal of Russian troops from the entire territory of Ukraine. Cancellation of illegal annexations. Demilitarization and de-occupation of the Zaporizhia Nuclear Power Plant. Restoration of freedom of movement," - the head of the OP listed Kyiv's conditions for ending the war.

He also added that Ukraine is ready to take into account the interests of other interested parties. However, "any adjustments must be based on international law and justice, territorial integrity and inviolability of Ukraine's borders, as well as our full sovereignty."

Russia should fully withdraw from Ukrainian territory, establishing a neutral buffer zone along the border of approximately one mile, similar to typical international borders. An agreement that Ukraine, along with other neighboring countries, will not join NATO should address Russia's security concerns without compromising Ukraine's sovereignty. This solution allows Russia to achieve its stated objectives while ensuring Ukraine retains its land and autonomy. Any other outcome would grant Russia an unfair advantage.

question: Who co-created the television series *House of the Dragon* along with Ryan Condal?
result:
The co-creator of the television series *House of the Dragon* alongside Ryan Condal is George R.R. Martin.
        

**Summary:** The television series *House of the Dragon* was co-created by George R.R. Martin in collaboration with Ryan Condal. This partnership combines Martin's extensive background in fantasy literature, particularly his work on *A Song of Ice and Fire*, with Condal's experience in television writing and production. Their collaboration aims to expand the rich lore of the *Game of Thrones* universe, ensuring a compelling narrative for fans of the franchise.

search_results.description:
Thank you to Ray Kromphold for this extremely thoughtful gift.  It will be my constant companion as I write CRY HAVOC.

And, if CRY HAVOC is adapted into a Prime Video series, I wouldn’t be surprised if this very lighter ends up in the hands of Tom Reece.  

Thank you.  I am honored.

I got to meet Tony Todd a few years back at a scifi convention in Roanoke, I asked him about working with Brandon Lee on The Crow.

I will never forget the way he lit up talking about working with Brandon.

question: How is Tetris used as a relaxation tool?
result:
Tetris is often associated with relaxation and stress relief, as indicated by users expressing their need to unwind and de-stress after overwhelming situations. The game serves as a creative outlet, with connections made to Tetris art and fan expressions, suggesting that engaging with Tetris can provide a sense of calm and enjoyment. Additionally, users mention taking breaks from more intense games like Apex Legends to focus on lighter, more soothing experiences, highlighting Tetris as a preferred choice for relaxation during stressful times. Overall, Tetris is seen as a tool for both creative expression and a means to alleviate stress, allowing players to find a balance in their gaming experiences.

question: What is the refund policy for Learn Enough tutorials?
result:
Learn Enough tutorials offers a full refund to customers who are not satisfied with their projects, emphasizing a straightforward, no-strings-attached policy for requesting refunds within a specified timeframe. This approach aims to provide ease and security in the investment process, ensuring customer satisfaction.

search_results.description:
🦾 We’re so confident in our projects, we’re giving you the power to decide.

Get a full refund if you're not satisfied - no strings, no stress, just smart investing.

🤔 How does it work?

Simply request a refund within a given period, and we’ve got you covered. 

It’s as simple as it sounds. ✅

As a customer, the returning exchange policy it is very ridiculous. I wasn’t asking for a full refund. Just a simple exchange, but you guys make it difficult day by day , and it makes it more harder to bring customers like me want to come back and shop more.

Returnless refunds are a tool that more retailers are using to keep online shoppers happy and to reduce shipping fees, processing time and other ballooning from mountains of returned products. https://t.co/Q6NGyAlNaH
If I pay for your service, something happens, and your first option is to refund me instead of looking at how to go about the issue, best believe I’m never doing business with you again

@JElvisWeinstein *if at any point you are not fully satisfied with your savings, you may return the unused portion for a full refund

* allow 6-8 months for delivery of refund of time
We have a strict no refund policy just in case at any time during the next four years, you experience buyer's remorse. Sorry that's company policy.
You can refund money but you can’t refund time. & a refund doesn’t compensate for the negative experience. This is customer service 101
Many retailers offer 'returnless refunds.' Just don't expect them to talk much about it (Business) https://t.co/XibhIuxDve
Do not support hate and division. Developers like this need to learn a lesson. Refund this game if you can.

YOU SHOULD ASK FOR A REFUND 

😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂💯😂 https://t.co/ADXJnAhLxu
